meanings.definition: The process of skin aging due to exposure to sunlight.
meanings.sent1: Photoaging can lead to wrinkles and age spots on the skin.
meanings.sent2: Many people develop photoaging from spending too much time in the sun without protection.
meanings.sent3: I heard that photoaging is like the skin's way of saying, 'I need some shade!'
meanings.sent4: Her face showed signs of photoaging, like a map of all the sunny days she had enjoyed.
meanings.sent5: The dermatologist explained how to prevent photoaging by wearing sunscreen every day.

meanings.definition: The effects of aging on the skin caused by sun exposure.
meanings.sent1: Excessive sun exposure can accelerate photoaging and make the skin look older.
meanings.sent2: Photoaging can make the skin more prone to damage and discoloration.
meanings.sent3: I never realized how much photoaging could make someone look like a raisin!
meanings.sent4: The photoaging on her hands was a reminder of all the sunny days spent gardening.
meanings.sent5: The photoaging on his face was a stark contrast to the smooth skin on his neck.
